p: The immune response after vaccination with the mumps vaccine (containing Urabe strain) has been studied in developing countries. A lower antigen response was found in subjects with measles and mumps vaccination for a nine-month-old group than for a 12â€“15-month-old group in India [ 110]. Among children aged 12 months, the immunogenicity response rate was 98% in Taiwan [ 111] and 92% in India [ 110]. In the United Kingdom, a study showed that the seropositivity rates were 85% at 4 years after a single dose of MMR vaccination with the Urabe strain vaccine, compared with 81% for vaccination with the Jeryl Lynn strain [ 112]. In Canada, a study found that five to six years after one dose of MMR vaccine, the seropositivity rate was 93% for the Urabe strain, compared with 85% for the Jeryl Lynn strain [ 113, 114, 115].
